resource_explanation: Briefs are summarized information about their non-brief counterpart. They are synced in the background after information related to a assessment is changed. You can consume this data to implement your own reporting tools.
explanation: Returns a paged list of assessment brief records.

response_fields.markdown: The date the brief was created.
response_fields.name: createdAt
response_fields.description: The date the brief was created.

response_fields.markdown: The date the assessment was created.
response_fields.name: assessmentCreatedAt
response_fields.description: The date the assessment was created.

response_fields.markdown: The date the brief was last updated.
response_fields.name: updatedAt
response_fields.description: The date the brief was last updated.

response_fields.markdown: The date the assessment was last updated.
response_fields.name: assessmentUpdatedAt
response_fields.description: The date the assessment was last updated.

response_fields.markdown: An object containing useful aggregate counts.
response_fields.name: counts
response_fields.description: An object containing useful aggregate counts.

response_fields.markdown: Indicates the number of submitted solutions compared to the total invites.
response_fields.name: submissionRate
response_fields.description: Indicates the number of submitted solutions compared to the total invites.

response_fields.markdown: Indicates the number of passed solutions compared to the total submitted.
response_fields.name: passRate
response_fields.description: Indicates the number of passed solutions compared to the total submitted.

response_fields.markdown: Indicates statistics related to team members who have taken the assessment.
response_fields.name: baselineStats
response_fields.description: Indicates statistics related to team members who have taken the assessment.

response_fields.markdown: Indicates statistics related to candidates who have taken the assessment.
response_fields.name: subjectStats
response_fields.description: Indicates statistics related to candidates who have taken the assessment.

response_fields.markdown: Indicates the passing score that is configured on the assessment. Any aggregate correctness score below this value is considered to be failed.
response_fields.name: passingScore
response_fields.description: Indicates the passing score that is configured on the assessment. Any aggregate correctness score below this value is considered to be failed.

resource_explanation: Briefs are summarized information about their non-brief counterpart. They are synced in the background after information related to a assessment is changed. You can consume this data to implement your own reporting tools.
explanation: Returns a specific assessment brief by id. Note that assessment briefs share the same id as the assessment that they represent.

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: The ID of the brief you wish to return. This is the same ID as the corresponding assessment.

response_fields.markdown: The date the brief was created.
response_fields.name: createdAt
response_fields.description: The date the brief was created.

response_fields.markdown: The date the assessment was created.
response_fields.name: assessmentCreatedAt
response_fields.description: The date the assessment was created.

response_fields.markdown: The date the brief was last updated.
response_fields.name: updatedAt
response_fields.description: The date the brief was last updated.

response_fields.markdown: The date the assessment was last updated.
response_fields.name: assessmentUpdatedAt
response_fields.description: The date the assessment was last updated.

response_fields.markdown: An object containing useful aggregate counts.
response_fields.name: counts
response_fields.description: An object containing useful aggregate counts.

response_fields.markdown: Indicates the number of submitted solutions compared to the total invites.
response_fields.name: submissionRate
response_fields.description: Indicates the number of submitted solutions compared to the total invites.

response_fields.markdown: Indicates the number of passed solutions compared to the total submitted.
response_fields.name: passRate
response_fields.description: Indicates the number of passed solutions compared to the total submitted.

response_fields.markdown: Indicates statistics related to team members who have taken the assessment.
response_fields.name: baselineStats
response_fields.description: Indicates statistics related to team members who have taken the assessment.

response_fields.markdown: Indicates statistics related to candidates who have taken the assessment.
response_fields.name: subjectStats
response_fields.description: Indicates statistics related to candidates who have taken the assessment.

response_fields.markdown: Indicates the passing score that is configured on the assessment. Any aggregate correctness score below this value is considered to be failed.
response_fields.name: passingScore
response_fields.description: Indicates the passing score that is configured on the assessment. Any aggregate correctness score below this value is considered to be failed.

resource_explanation: Endpoints for viewing and configuring which challenges which are associated to each assessment.
explanation:
Associates a challenge to an assessment by creating a AssessmentChallengeItem record. If
        the challenge already exists for the assessment, a 409 will be returned. If a global challenge
        is passed, a copy of it will be created for the given team and that copy will be used
        instead.

parameters.name: assessment_id
parameters.description: The ID of the assessment you wish to update an item on

parameters.name: data.challenge_id
parameters.description: The ID of the challenge you wish to associated to the assessment

resource_explanation: Endpoints for viewing and configuring which challenges which are associated to each assessment.
explanation:
Allows you to modify the position and disabled languages of the AssessmentChallengeItem record. When changing the position, all other items in the
        list will be adjusted to account for the item's new position. If you wish to replace the challenge, you should
        first delete the AssessmentChallengeItem that you wish to replace, then create a new one.

parameters.name: assessment_id
parameters.description: The ID of the assessment you wish to update an item on

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: The item ID (not the challenge ID)

parameters.name: data.position
parameters.description: 1 based index that determines the order of the challenge sequence for the assessment.

parameters.name: data.disabled_languages
parameters.description: An array of language identifiers (aka ["csharp", "ruby"]) which indicate which languages should not be allowed for the challenge

resource_explanation: Endpoints for viewing and configuring which challenges which are associated to each assessment.
explanation: Removes the AssessmentChallengeItem item from the assessment, causing the challenge to be disassociated.

parameters.name: assessment_id
parameters.description: The ID of the assessment you wish to remove an item from

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: The item ID (not the challenge ID)

resource_explanation: Endpoints for managing and creating invitations. Invitations are how candidates get explicitly introduced into the system. For private assessments, this is the only way to gain access to take the assessment.
explanation: The way to create a candidate within the system is to invite them to an assessment.

parameters.markdown: An array of candidate emails to send invitations to.
parameters.name: data.candidates
parameters.description: An array of candidate emails to send invitations to.

parameters.markdown: The ID of the assessment you wish to send the invitation for.
parameters.name: data.assessment_id
parameters.description: The ID of the assessment you wish to send the invitation for.

parameters.markdown: An array of team members ID strings that should be assigned to the candidate.
parameters.name: data.assigned_team_member_ids
parameters.description: An array of team members ID strings that should be assigned to the candidate.

parameters.markdown: An array of strings indicating which labels should be applied to the invited candidates.
parameters.name: data.labels
parameters.description: An array of strings indicating which labels should be applied to the invited candidates.

parameters.markdown: The date in which the invitation can no longer be accepted. Once the candidate starts the assessment, this value is no longer relevant.
parameters.name: data.expires_at
parameters.description: The date in which the invitation can no longer be accepted. Once the candidate starts the assessment, this value is no longer relevant.

parameters.markdown: The date in which a reminder email should be sent to the candidate. Only sent if the candidate has not started the assessment by the date.
parameters.name: data.reminder_at
parameters.description: The date in which a reminder email should be sent to the candidate. Only sent if the candidate has not started the assessment by the date.

parameters.markdown: Customizes the message that is emailed to the candidate.
parameters.name: data.custom_message
parameters.description: Customizes the message that is emailed to the candidate.

parameters.markdown: Set to false if you do not wish to send an invitation email. This can be useful for when you simply want to use the invitation_url returned by this request, and send that URL on your own.
parameters.name: data.send_invite_to_candidate
parameters.description: Set to false if you do not wish to send an invitation email. This can be useful for when you simply want to use the invitation_url returned by this request, and send that URL on your own.

parameters.markdown: Allows you to automatically reopen the assessment, if this invitation is being sent for a previously submitted assessment. This must be set to true if you are trying to invite a candidate to a submitted assessment, otherwise an error will be raised.
parameters.name: data.reopened_submitted
parameters.description: Allows you to automatically reopen the assessment, if this invitation is being sent for a previously submitted assessment. This must be set to true if you are trying to invite a candidate to a submitted assessment, otherwise an error will be raised.

parameters.markdown: Assessments can be configured with default expiration and reminder values. If this is true, then default will be applied if not specifically set.
parameters.name: data.apply_day_defaults
parameters.description: Assessments can be configured with default expiration and reminder values. If this is true, then default will be applied if not specifically set.

parameters.markdown: Set to true if you wish to prevent the candidate from starting the assessment until it is unlocked. This allows you to give access but still retain control of exactly when the candidate can start.
parameters.name: data.access_locked
parameters.description: Set to true if you wish to prevent the candidate from starting the assessment until it is unlocked. This allows you to give access but still retain control of exactly when the candidate can start.

parameters.markdown: First name of candidate, can only be used when single email is passed to candidates array
parameters.name: data.first_name
parameters.description: First name of candidate, can only be used when single email is passed to candidates array

parameters.markdown: Last name of candidate, can only be used when single email is passed to candidates array
parameters.name: data.last_name
parameters.description: Last name of candidate, can only be used when single email is passed to candidates array

resource_explanation: Each time a candidate takes an assessment, their work is stored within the assessment result.
explanation: Unlocks an access_locked assessment result so a candidate can begin their assessment.

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: The ID of the assessment result to unlock

resource_explanation: Each time a candidate takes an assessment, their work is stored within the assessment result.
explanation: Submits an assessment to be reviewed/screened by the company/team. This prevents the candidate from continuing, and generates a score. Some automated workflows may be triggered, but client-side workflow features such as show a message and redirect URL will be ignored.

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: The ID of the assessment result to submit

resource_explanation: Each time a candidate takes an assessment, their work is stored within the assessment result.
explanation: Reopens the assessment result so that the candidate can make changes.

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: The ID of the assessment result to reopen

resource_explanation: Each time a candidate takes an assessment, their work is stored within the assessment result.
explanation: Reopens an assessment result, and updates the challenges to the latest published version of the assessment.

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: The ID of the assessment result to reset.

parameters.name: data.reset_all
parameters.description: If true, completely remove all solutions and start from scratch. Otherwise, only update the assessment result and challenges list.\n\n**NOTE:** If set to true, all solutions will be removed. This is not reversible, solutions will be lost forever.

resource_explanation: Each time a candidate takes an assessment, their work is stored within the assessment result.
explanation: Enables completely destroying an assessment result that has not been started. NOTE: AssessmentResult state MUST be "invited" or "opened" to be destroyed.

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: The ID of the assessment result to delete.

resource_explanation: Assessment templates are pre-built assessments which you can use as-is or as a starting point to build your own.

resource_explanation: Assessment templates are pre-built assessments which you can use as-is or as a starting point to build your own.
explanation: Imports the assessment template as a new assessment on your team.

parameters.description: The ID of the template you wish to import into your team.

resource_explanation: An Assessment contains one or more challenges that are given to a candidate to assess them on their ability. Typically an AssessmentInvitation is used to invite a TeamCandidate to take it, which will also create an AssessmentResult - which is the record used to track the candidate's assessment progress.
explanation: Returns a paged list of all assessments for your team.

parameters.description: ie: "title DESC"

parameters.name: page
parameters.description: Default = 1

resource_explanation: An Assessment contains one or more challenges that are given to a candidate to assess them on their ability. Typically an AssessmentInvitation is used to invite a TeamCandidate to take it, which will also create an AssessmentResult - which is the record used to track the candidate's assessment progress.
explanation: Returns assessment for both authenticated and unauthenticated users. Only admins and team members can see unpublished assessments.

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: The ID of the assessment you wish to retrieve.

resource_explanation: An Assessment contains one or more challenges that are given to a candidate to assess them on their ability. Typically an AssessmentInvitation is used to invite a TeamCandidate to take it, which will also create an AssessmentResult - which is the record used to track the candidate's assessment progress.
explanation: Creates a new assessment in a draft state. If you wish to create an assessment within a published state, you should first create the assessment, use the Assessment Challenge Items API to add challenges, then call the Assessment publish endpoint.

parameters.markdown: What this assessment will be titled as.
parameters.name: data.title
parameters.description: What this assessment will be titled as.

parameters.markdown: Used to display a short summary to candidates about the assessment.

parameters.description: Used to display a short summary to candidates about the assessment.

parameters.markdown: Internal value useful for explaining to team members why what this assessment is focused on.
parameters.name: data.purpose
parameters.description: Internal value useful for explaining to team members why what this assessment is focused on.

parameters.markdown: An array of label strings to assign to the assessment. Any value can be used, it does not need to be previously defined.
parameters.name: data.labels
parameters.description: An array of label strings to assign to the assessment. Any value can be used, it does not need to be previously defined.

resource_explanation: An Assessment contains one or more challenges that are given to a candidate to assess them on their ability. Typically an AssessmentInvitation is used to invite a TeamCandidate to take it, which will also create an AssessmentResult - which is the record used to track the candidate's assessment progress.
explanation: Publishes a draft assessment. There must be at least one challenge item associated, and all challenges must already be published.

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: Assessment ID

resource_explanation: An Assessment contains one or more challenges that are given to a candidate to assess them on their ability. Typically an AssessmentInvitation is used to invite a TeamCandidate to take it, which will also create an AssessmentResult - which is the record used to track the candidate's assessment progress.
explanation: Moves an assessment back to the draft state, preventing new invitations from being able to be sent for this assessment. Existing invitations will remain active.

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: Assessment ID

resource_explanation: An Assessment contains one or more challenges that are given to a candidate to assess them on their ability. Typically an AssessmentInvitation is used to invite a TeamCandidate to take it, which will also create an AssessmentResult - which is the record used to track the candidate's assessment progress.
explanation: Archives the assessment. Any active invitations will be cancelled, and any started assessment results will be closed.

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: Assessment ID

resource_explanation: An Assessment contains one or more challenges that are given to a candidate to assess them on their ability. Typically an AssessmentInvitation is used to invite a TeamCandidate to take it, which will also create an AssessmentResult - which is the record used to track the candidate's assessment progress.
explanation: Unlocks any access_locked assessment results associated with this assessment. Note the results are unlocked asynchronously.

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: The ID of the assessment you wish to unlock assessment results for.

resource_explanation: Briefs are summarized information about their non-brief counterpart. They are synced in the background after information related to a challenge is changed. You can consume this data to implement your own reporting tools. Note that all challenge types have been combined into one object, so you will notice fields on each record that may not be relevant to the underlying challenge type.
explanation: Returns a paged list of challenge brief records.

response_fields.markdown: The date the brief was created.

response_fields.description: The date the brief was created.

response_fields.markdown: The date the challenge was created.

response_fields.markdown: The date the brief was last updated.
response_fields.name: updatedAt
response_fields.description: The date the brief was last updated.

response_fields.markdown: The date the challenge was last updated.
response_fields.name: challengeUpdatedAt
response_fields.description: The date the challenge was last updated.

response_fields.markdown: A viable solution is one that enough work was put into it that it is considered attempted enough to be included within statistics.

response_fields.markdown: The number of submitted solutions vs the total number of solutions for this challenge.

response_fields.description: The number of submitted solutions vs the total number of solutions for this challenge.

response_fields.markdown: The total number of viable solutions that have reached the passing_score threshold.

resource_explanation: Briefs are summarized information about their non-brief counterpart. They are synced in the background after information related to a challenge is changed. You can consume this data to implement your own reporting tools. Note that all challenge types have been combined into one object, so you will notice fields on each record that may not be relevant to the underlying challenge type.
explanation: Returns a specific challenge brief by id. Note that assessment briefs share the same id as the assessment that they represent.

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: The ID of the brief you wish to return. This is the same ID as the corresponding challenge.

resource_explanation: General endpoints for working with various types of challenges. The $type parameter will often be warranted as it will allow you to specify the type of challenge that should be handled.
explanation: Returns all Qualified and team challenges. You can limit results by type or collection to refine the results.

parameters.name: collection
parameters.description: if provided will filter by either `"team"` or `"global"` (qualified) challenges.

parameters.name: templates
parameters.description: If set to true, will return only templates. By default everything but templates are returned.

parameters.name: $type
parameters.description: The type of challenge to filter by.

resource_explanation: General endpoints for working with various types of challenges. The $type parameter will often be warranted as it will allow you to specify the type of challenge that should be handled.

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: The ID of the challenge you wish to retrieve. This can either be a Qualified library challenge or a one associated to your team.

parameters.name: includes
parameters.description: includes

resource_explanation: General endpoints for working with various types of challenges. The $type parameter will often be warranted as it will allow you to specify the type of challenge that should be handled.
explanation: Create a Classic Code Challenge (simply called CodeChallenge within the API). You should specify "CodeChallenge" as the $type.

parameters.name: data.$type
parameters.description: The type of challenge to create. For this example you are required to pass "CodeChallenge"

parameters.markdown: The title of the challenge to refer to it by. This title will not be shown to candidates.
parameters.name: data.title
parameters.description: The title of the challenge to refer to it by. This title will not be shown to candidates.

resource_explanation: One or more QuizQuestions are associated to a QuizChallenge (aka "Q&A Challenge"). These questions define the questions that a candidate will be given.
explanation: Creates a quiz question for a QuizChallenge. $type must be provided to specify the type of question being created. $type cannot be changed once the record is created.

parameters.markdown: The question prompt. Markdown is supported.
parameters.name: data.prompt
parameters.description: The question prompt. Markdown is supported.

parameters.markdown: The model type of the question.
parameters.name: data.$type
parameters.description: The model type of the question.

parameters.markdown: The ID of the challenge to add the question to.
parameters.name: data.challenge_id
parameters.description: The ID of the challenge to add the question to.

parameters.markdown: The 1 based position of the challenge within the list. Will be auto-set to the end of the list if omitted.
parameters.name: data.position
parameters.description: The 1 based position of the challenge within the list. Will be auto-set to the end of the list if omitted.

parameters.markdown: The weight to assign to this question. The default is 1.
parameters.name: data.weight
parameters.description: The weight to assign to this question. The default is `1`.

parameters.markdown: True if fractional scoring should not be performed.
parameters.name: data.all_or_nothing
parameters.description: True if fractional scoring should not be performed.

id.desc: The ID of the choice. When making updates, you will want to preserve this value so that previous existing answers can be properly reported on.

label.desc: The text of the choice. Markdown is supported.

value.desc: The value/weight of the choice. Use 0 if the choice is not correct. Negative values are also supported, which can be used to take away points from other correct choices selected.

parameters.markdown: An array of objects defining what choices should be available for the question.
parameters.name: data.choices
parameters.description: An array of objects defining what choices should be available for the question.

parameters.markdown: The total number of choices a candidate can select.
parameters.name: data.max_selections
parameters.description: The total number of choices a candidate can select.

parameters.markdown: The maximum sum that can be scored. Useful when using multiple weighted choices and it is possible to weight higher than the total that you may wish to score.
parameters.name: data.max_sum
parameters.description: The maximum sum that can be scored. Useful when using multiple weighted choices and it is possible to weight higher than the total that you may wish to score.

parameters.markdown: True if weighted scoring should be used. Otherwise all choices will count as an equal weight, regardless of what their individual weights are set as.
parameters.name: data.weighted_scoring
parameters.description: True if weighted scoring should be used. Otherwise all choices will count as an equal weight, regardless of what their individual weights are set as.

parameters.markdown: The minimum number of characters that an answer needs to have.
parameters.name: data.min_characters
parameters.description: The minimum number of characters that an answer needs to have.

parameters.markdown: The maximum number of characters that an answer can have.
parameters.name: data.max_characters
parameters.description: The maximum number of characters that an answer can have.

parameters.markdown: Provide a default answer text if you want the candidate to modify something, such as performing a manually-scored refactoring or other text transformation.
parameters.name: data.default_value
parameters.description: Provide a default answer text if you want the candidate to modify something, such as performing a manually-scored refactoring or other text transformation.

case.desc: True if case sensitivity should be used.

multi.desc: True if multiline regex flag should be used.

negate.desc: True if the the answer SHOULD'T match.

parameters.markdown: An array of objects used to calculate score by matching answer text.
parameters.name: data.matches
parameters.description: An array of objects used to calculate score by matching answer text.

resource_explanation: Endpoints for managing your web subscriptions. The Qualified UI currently only supports a single subscription, but more can be managed programmatically via this API.
explanation: Deletes a webhook subscription by matching the webhook URL to the one provided.

parameters.name: url
parameters.description: The webhook URL of the subscription you wish to delete.
